hackathon-description-text: HackGenY and eBay are now partering to invite Israel's 150 top young bright hackers, to show the world what they can do within 36 hours. But with a twist.
hackathon-requirements:
All hacks must utilize eBay's API. The mission of the Hackathon is:
"Build viral mobile applications, centered on Gamification, with eBay's API"
hackathon-rules:
Only teams comprised wholly of eligible participants that submit their hacks to this DevPost, and then go on to demo their hack at HackGenY can win prizes. 
- YOU MUST BE AT HACKGENY TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION
- You cannot work on your project before the event begins
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards
- Please comply with all instructions from HackGenY organizers
- Be respectful to the people around you
- Do not vandalize the WIX building in any way.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Cash prize to the winning team, purchasing their product

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Nemal Tel Aviv St 40, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack practical given its target audience? Is it something that the user base would actually use? Does it fulfill a need people have?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well-designed?

hackathon-location-address: Nemal Tel Aviv St 40, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
hackathon-description-header: Hacking Generation Y and eBay are partnering to find Israel's brightest youth!
